author: Paddy Whack
comment: Sometimes it crashes my Moto 360.        Edit: Upgraded to Moto 360 gen 2 and Android 6.0.  It works perfectly now and actually does what I wanted it for which is monitor my heart rate during long bike rides. I do hope the developers make it so it can measure my heart rate every 5 or 10 minutes though instead of just every 30. Continuously might be pushing the battery too much, but it still works great.
title: Moto 360 gen 2

author: Levi Jackson
comment: So I figured out why I was having so much trouble. You MUST leave it running at ALL times in the background, and you have to start it manually whenever you start up your phone. It works flawlessly as long as it is running. Add it to your exempt list if you use a task killer.

reply.author: LFApp
reply.content:
Hi, all data is stored directly to Google Fit.
You can check to google fit web to make sure of it : https://fit.google.com/

title: Figured it out. GREAT!

author: Carlo Alberto Filiberti
comment: In the app fix list there is written that this version fixes heart rate check on Huawei but it does not. I have a huawei watch and even if you set the "checking timeout" at 30 secs the app hangs after some time. The heart rate sensor stays lighten up indefinitely and the app does not measure anything. The only way to unlock the situation is to run a check with the "huawei heart rate app".  Anyway please fix it. I bought the pro version because the apps is very promising but if it continue with this trend, I think I will really uninstall it.    For now I will give 2 stars. If the problem I mentioned will be fixed I will gladly give 5.

author: Kurt Jenney
comment: Great for forcing heart rate readings on watches that don't periodically check it. It doesn't increase battery use by much on my Huawei watch either.  It will occasionally cause the HR sensor to crash if sleep as Android takes control of the sensor overnight.  I will have to restart the watch to fix it.

This app works well as promised. But I think it would benefit from a material design overhaul. Do that, and I will buy pro dev please respond, edit, no response, switched to heart trace, check it out guys
title: Visuals

author: Chris Kerry
comment: Recently a fix was put in for Huawei watch and now it is not accurate for LG Urbane. Also, no way to schedule multiple off times other than just 1. Paid for full version but still lacks features. Can't get dev to respond to emails.

reply.author: LFApp
reply.content: Hi, got your email. Added your idea to the feature request list

title: Not as accurate as it used to be

author: Brian Malloy
comment: New Pixel XL and had issue with Google fit but seems turning off body sensor setting then back on might fix it. But a very stable app and works great.
title: Always worked well and support is great

author: Desmond Lim
comment: I can only give 2 stars. It did not seems to check the HR for every 5 min. Sometimes it did not check at all. Send feedback twice but seems unable to reslove the problem. By the way, I am using Huawei watch.

author: James Conigrave
comment: Works well without impacting battery greatly. The actual graph display is difficult to read. Would like to see week and month averages so long term trends are easier to discern.

author: Sherman G
comment: Thanks to the developer for working with me correcting the issues with my watch. Every developer should take notes. I'll gladly purchase anything this developer releases. Thanks again! 😃😃😃

reply.author: LFApp
reply.content:
Hi,
Can you see the HROS app on your watch, to make sure it's already synced.
Please send me the log via send - feedback and information android wear version on your watch

title: Everything working on my Huawei watch after the last update.

author: Adam Hsieh
comment: Great app. Does what it advertises. I would actually consider paying for the PRO version if it weren't for the fact that it hasn't been updated in 1.5 years. No optimistic about future support or improvements. At this point I'd probably consider it abandoned by the dev.

author: Magyari Gábor
comment: reads and detect the heart rate even when the watch is not on my wrist and gives false result. I cant see which is mine and which false result - Huawei Watch

author: Ryan Mennis
comment: Actually checks on the schedule you set it too! Provides for a graph of average heartreate of minutes, hours, etc. over a day, week, etc. Although I it would seem to be most useful to purchase the pro key so it can take heartrate reading more often than half hour intervals (to provide for quality control agains spikes), it is useful.I recommend pairing this app with Sport Gear Tracker as it can take your heartrate continuously over a period of activity, and provides data for max, min, and average heartrate.
title: Lg Urbane

author: Alex Chu
comment: Hit or miss because of the inaccuracies of the watch based heart rate sensor. App itself works great and I like the charts.

author: Bushovsky Igor
comment: Make Android Wear app independent from Mobile phone as when BT is disabled then "Heart Rate OS2" shows as app has stopped working on Android Wear. This is not suitable for such app to have such an issue. Please fix it  Device: HTC One M8 Dual Sim Anroid: 6.0.1 Smart watch: Moto 360 Sport (Android 6.0.1 > 5 August 2016 update)

author: Valerie Schoepfer
comment: Good, and even bought the Pro key.  But I still can't download my HR data from the past six months by day.  It returns an empty file.

author: Harshal Vora
comment: The heart rate is not being tracked continuously,  which is the sole purpose I installed the app. I am using a huawei watch and this app is not useful

author: Chuck Hannah
comment: I have Notification set to 'Warning' but I am still seeing the HR being measured notifications. Please help, I really like the warning notifications. Great app!
title: Great app...but annoying notification.

author: Mark Sorensen
comment: I have a Huawei Watch and am experiencing the exact same issue as Carlo Alberto. I would appreciate if your support team would comment on this issue as it has been raised twice now in your product review.

author: Graeme Anderson
comment: Huawei watch now working - provides a reading (high) when not on wrist, ideally would know if this is the case - best on market
title: Near perfect

author: Gee Bee
comment: At least not urbane 2 unless phone is connected to watch. Otherwise it appears stable and accurate enough
title: Not stand alone on watch

author: Shelley Smith
comment: Brilliant - impressive, especially for a free app, so I donated. Does what it is supposed to do, is stable and has never crashed, and never had a problem with it at all. I am looking forward to seeing some additional features. It would be great if I could set the app to automatically monitor my heart rate every 15 minutes while I sleep, and every 5 minutes during the day. I do it manually at the moment. But great app and highly recommended.

author: Karthik Raju
comment: This is an awesome app. We have to manually trigger a heart rate check with the  smart watches and most of them don't check it automatically at an interval.  This wonderfully does what smart watches cannot do.

author: David James
comment: By allowing me to schedule a heart rate measurement every hour it let's me get the most out of the heart monitor on my watch.  It would be nice if I could set the schedule start and end times to different values at the weekend.
title: Does what I want.

author: Aleksandr Tischenko
comment: Only one issue still exists - when I don't wear my watch, regular HR checking returns values like 90-95. It needs some filtering, probably using other sensors.
title: Polar M600 & Meizu MX5

author: Robert Wagnon
comment: This is the ONLY app for Android Wear that can collect daily stats like Fitbit.  Upload to Google Fit and sync with FitnessSync to get dashboard.
title: No better app

author: Mike Morley
comment: Seems to work but has some bugs which are preventing me from buying. Time is out by 1hour which means not reading local time. Doesn't always perform a test every hour even though this is set.using Huawei. UI could do with an update.

author: Jamie Slatten
comment: I love that I can choose how often it auto checks my heart rate via my android watch. And the BPM to warn me that my heart is to fast for relaxing rate.
title: Great program

comment: The app works well and does what it's supposed to, but the visual design reminds me of 90s software, it's so outdated.  The app would benefit greatly from a Material design.
title: Good, but could use a redesign

author: Bill Baird
comment: Works okay on Moto 360 Sport, but lots of bogus readings when watch is not being worn.
Does not work on OnePlus 5 with Android Oreo, only works if app is open.

author: Kristen Adams
comment: It doesnt work for a zenwatch 2 andriod wear

reply.author: LFApp
reply.content:
Hi,
Can you give more information and send the log via feedback.
Please inform if HROS app shown in the watch.

title: Zen watch 2

author: Brad McKay
comment: Love the premises of this app, and the developer follows through with updates and compatibility fixes after the fact. No complaints so far!
title: Adds what should be a native feature

author: Walter Burnell
comment: when it's working, I like it.  frequently fails to update heart rate on the hour.

author: ben roberts
comment: Doesn't track with Huawei Watch 1 like the app says  I set it to every 30 minutes but never would test for the heart rate

author: Leslie Shapiro
comment: It says to "click to start" IT did not work!!! Useless app!!!
title: Does nothing on watch

author: wil wu
comment: Why it does not work with my Huawei  Watch 2?

author: Bruno Sokic
comment: Automatic checks don't work on my Nexus 6P.
title: Doesn't work

author: Darren Wright
comment: i use this to monitor my heart in my bipolar to see if i go up or down or if am cycling brilliant app thank-you for making it.
title: brilliant

author: Zahri Anshori
comment: Loved It...   Please make warning notif Vibrate longer or different with standart notif...  i can use this app to prevent sleeping when studying or driving...   Mantap GAN...
